holidays.name: International Day of Friendship
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the importance of friends and friendships around the world.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2011 to promote peace and bridge cultures through friendship.
holidays.funFact: It's said that a genuine friend can help reduce stress and even improve your lifespan‚Äîfriends really are the family you choose!

holidays.name: Father-in-Law Day
holidays.description: A quirky holiday to honor the often underappreciated father-in-law and acknowledge his role in the family.
holidays.origin: Created in 1981 by Sonora Smart Dodd, who also created Father's Day, though this one remained much more niche.
holidays.funFact: Unlike Father's Day, Father-in-Law Day hasn't caught on widely, so wishing your father-in-law a happy day is guaranteed to surprise him!

holidays.name: Talk Like a Pirate Day
holidays.description: A fun observance where people speak in pirate lingo, wear pirate costumes, and celebrate pirate culture with jest and humor.
holidays.origin: Started as a joke in 1995 by friends John Baur and Mark Summers, inspired by a pirate-themed episode of a TV show.
holidays.funFact: International Talk Like a Pirate Day has led to real piracy-themed promotions and even special offers at some bars and restaurants worldwide.

holidays.name: Cheese Slice Day
holidays.description: A deliciously quirky day celebrating the mighty cheese slice, an essential in many sandwiches and snacks.
holidays.origin: Created by food enthusiasts to highlight the convenience and taste of pre-sliced cheese processing.
holidays.funFact: The invention of the cheese slicer in the early 20th century in Norway was a game-changer, but the pre-sliced cheese we celebrate today became popular only in the 1950s!
